content: Note:   Tabulations for middle-income adults only, defined as those with family income from $40,000 to $99,000. Percents may not sum to 100 due to rounding and question nonresponse.       Source:  Federal Reserve Board, 2018 Survey of Household Economics and Decisionmaking; calculations by Board staff.   6%  27%  65%  Not able to pay  Borrow or sell something  Savings, cash, or equivalent  Figure 5.  How middle-income adults would pay an  unexpected $400 expense
